newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila central bank offers dlrs at 26.235 pesos.
newsitem.headline: Manila central bank offers dlrs at 26.235 pesos.

text.p: Philippine central bank officials said on Thursday the bank was offering to sell dollars at 26.235 pesos after the local currency was battered by rumours that Defence Minister Renato de Villa was killed.
De Villa's staff denied the rumours, and said he was alive and in a budget meeting.
A Central Bank official said they were offering to buy at 26.19 pesos and sell at 26.235 pesos when asked by Reuters what steps are being taken to calm the market.
"If they (banks) want to hit us (on the sell side), they can have the dollars," the official said.
The official said she did not see any reason for the peso to become volatile in the last minutes of trading.
The peso hit a low of 26.235 to the dollar on Thursday, sharply down from its Wednesday close of 26.193.
The peso recovered after the rumour was denied by De Villa's staff. It was last quoted at 26.231.
